jobDescription: At Northrop Grumman, our employees  have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems in air and space  that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come.  Our work preserves freedom and democracy, and advances human discovery and our  understanding of the universe. We look for people who have bold new ideas,  courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have a  lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity,  cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an  insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not  only part of history, they're making history.  Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems  has an opening for an Architect Modeling Engineer Systems Engineer 3. This  position will be located in Redondo  Beach, CA.  The individual in this role will  perform architecture modeling and analysis activities in the Systems Analysis  & Simulation (SE&I;) IPT of the GS&MS; organization. This individual  will be responsible for developing and maintaining architecture modeling  capability for captures and programs across the sector. This person will serve  as a subject matter expert for small programs, trade studies, and CRAD  activities that need architecture modeling. Their expertise isavailable  to lead architecture modeling efforts on small projects, CRAD, and IRAD efforts. Essential DutiesApply architecture frameworks and concepts uniformly  across all sector programsWork with Model Based System Engineering efforts by the  functional team to leverage current architecture modeling tool sets.Establish and maintain a repository (unclassified and  classified where possible) of architecture modeling data for rapid starts  on new projectsBridge architecture models with physics based  performance simulations and with campaign modeling efforts across the  SA&S; IPT to develop a Models Based or model-centric engineering  approach The goal is to facilitate and share  models and simulations across all new projects. This lead will collaborate with  the RTE functions and COEs to spread architecture modeling fundamentals. Some  travel will be required in this position. Responsibilities includeCreating and implementing a roadmap to fulfill sector  need to utilize common architecture modeling frameworks and concepts for  analysis and strategic decision making.Develop a common repository of architecture modeling  data and structures.Provide technical leadership on funded studies that  have architecture modeling scope.Develop and review documentation related to  architecture modeling and tool usage, assumptions, and limitations.  Coordinate with programs and functional to share best practices and  develop and maintain on IRAD standard MBSE and architecture modeling style  guides and templates.Demonstrate excellent communication skills as frequent  interactions with programs, functional, across sectors, and other IPTs are  expected.Provide technical leadership and guidance to a team of  system engineers/ architects in the areas of Systems Engineering Analysis,  Architecture Modeling, and MBSE.Basic  Qualifications:Bachelors of Science degree in a STEM  (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math) field from an accredited  institution and5 years of engineering experience in an aerospace  environment ORMasters of Science degree in a STEM  (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math) field from an accredited  institution and3 years of engineering experience in an aerospace  environmentPractical  working experience inarchitecture analysis processes and  documentation requirementsTechnical experience in  Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) tools/standards (i.e. Cameo, Magic Draw,  Rhapsody, System Architect, Enterprise Architect, etc.)Demonstrated  experience in Department of Defense Architecture Frameworks (DODAF) such  as SysML, UML, or UPDMActive In-Scope DoD Top Secret Security  Clearance with current SSBI accessPreferred  Qualifications:Master's  Degree in Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Operational Research, Applied  MathematicsWorking  knowledge in various aspects of architecture modeling for Space and/or Unmanned  Aerial Systems (air/space vehicle, ground station, operations, sensor payloads,  and/or communications)Experience  developing architectures through CDRExpertise in  MBE development and integration of models for performance and functional  analysisStrong  communication skills required to support frequent customer interactionsTeam player/  leader with strong analytical skills Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring  and retaining a diverse workforce.
